/*# sourceMappingURL=/sm/80ab6bb7f46341a19c9640e6091089491733986ca6139231b5e3060ce2b68801.map */code[class*=language-],pre[class*=language-]{color:#000;background:0 0;text-shadow:0 1px #fff;font-family:Consolas,Monaco,'Andale Mono','Ubuntu Mono',monospace;font-size:1em;text-align:left;white-space:pre;word-spacing:normal;word-break:normal;word-wrap:normal;line-height:1.5;-moz-tab-size:4;-o-tab-size:4;tab-size:4;-webkit-hyphens:none;-moz-hyphens:none;-ms-hyphens:none;hyphens:none}code[class*=language-] ::-moz-selection,code[class*=language-]::-moz-selection,pre[class*=language-] ::-moz-selection,pre[class*=language-]::-moz-selection{text-shadow:none;background:#b3d4fc}code[class*=language-] ::selection,code[class*=language-]::selection,pre[class*=language-] ::selection,pre[class*=language-]::selection{text-shadow:none;background:#b3d4fc}@media print{code[class*=language-],pre[class*=language-]{text-shadow:none}}pre[class*=language-]{padding:1em;margin:.5em 0;overflow:auto}:not(pre)>code[class*=language-],pre[class*=language-]{background:#f5f2f0}:not(pre)>code[class*=language-]{padding:.1em;border-radius:.3em;white-space:normal}.token.cdata,.token.comment,.token.doctype,.token.prolog{color:#708090}.token.punctuation{color:#999}.token.namespace{opacity:.7}.token.boolean,.token.constant,.token.deleted,.token.number,.token.property,.token.symbol,.token.tag{color:#905}.token.attr-name,.token.builtin,.token.char,.token.inserted,.token.selector,.token.string{color:#690}.language-css .token.string,.style .token.string,.token.entity,.token.operator,.token.url{color:#9a6e3a;background:hsla(0,0%,100%,.5)}.token.atrule,.token.attr-value,.token.keyword{color:#07a}.token.class-name,.token.function{color:#dd4a68}.token.important,.token.regex,.token.variable{color:#e90}.token.bold,.token.important{font-weight:700}.token.italic{font-style:italic}.token.entity{cursor:help}</style><div class="markdown-body"><h1 id="digital-colony">Digital Colony</h1>
<a href="{{ '/' | relative_url }}">Return to index</a><br>
<a href="{{ '/Challenges/Digital-Colony/' | relative_URL }}">Return to challenge page</a>
<p>Digital colonies have digits living in a one-dimensional space. There are 10 different types of digits ranging from <code>0</code> to <code>9</code>. A digital colony grows larger after every generation.</p>
<p>For each pair of digits in the colony, a new digit is produced in between them in the next generation. To find the new digit we need to calculate the weight of the colony in the current generation and the signature of the pairs.</p>
<p>Here we shall use the <code>914</code> colony as an example and look at how it grows to the next generation.</p>
<p><u>Weight of the colony</u></p>
<p>The weight is calculated by summing up all the digits in the colony, so in this case we get <code>9 + 1 + 4 = 14</code>.</p>
<p><u>Signature of the pairs</u></p>
<p>Looking at the first pair <code>91</code>, the difference between them is <code>9 - 1 = 8</code>, so the signature of a <code>91</code> pair is <code>8</code>.</p>
<p>But the order matters, so for a <code>19</code> pair we need to subtract the difference from <code>10</code>. So the signature of a <code>19</code> pair is <code>10 - 8 = 2</code>. </p>
<p>For a pair with the same digits, the signature is always <code>0</code>. So the signature of <code>44</code> pair is <code>0</code>.</p>
<p>Now let's also calculate the signature of the second pair <code>14</code>, which is <code>10 - 3 = 7</code></p>
<p><u>New digit produced by the pairs</u></p>
<p>First, we sum up the weight of the colony and the signature of the pair.</p>
<p>Then, we take the last digit of this sum to be the new digit.</p>
<p>For the <code>91</code> pair, the sum is <code>14 + 8 = 22</code>. So the new digit will be <code>2</code>.</p>
<p>For the <code>14</code> pair, the sum is <code>14 + 7 = 21</code>. So the new digit will be <code>1</code>.</p>
<p><u>Colony in the next generations</u></p>
<p>After each pair in <code>914</code> produces a new digit, the <code>914</code> colony will become <code>92114</code> in the next generation.</p>
<p>Note that we need to consider all the pairs at the same time, which means the pairs can overlap. Also, the new digits produced are not considered to be part of any pairs until the next generation.</p>
<p>With the above rules, the <code>914</code> colony will grow as follows:</p>
<pre><code>Starting Colony <span class="token number">914</span>  <span class="token operator">=&gt;</span>  <span class="token number">9</span>               <span class="token number">1</span>               <span class="token number">4</span>  <span class="token operator">=&gt;</span>  Weight <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token number">14</span>
After <span class="token number">1</span> <span class="token parameter">generation</span>   <span class="token operator">=&gt;</span>  <span class="token number">9</span>       <span class="token number">2</span>       <span class="token number">1</span>       <span class="token number">1</span>       <span class="token number">4</span>  <span class="token operator">=&gt;</span>  Weight <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token number">17</span>
After <span class="token number">2</span> <span class="token parameter">generations</span>  <span class="token operator">=&gt;</span>  <span class="token number">9</span>   <span class="token number">4</span>   <span class="token number">2</span>   <span class="token number">8</span>   <span class="token number">1</span>   <span class="token number">7</span>   <span class="token number">1</span>   <span class="token number">4</span>   <span class="token number">4</span>  <span class="token operator">=&gt;</span>  Weight <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token number">40</span>
After <span class="token number">3</span> <span class="token parameter">generations</span>  <span class="token operator">=&gt;</span>  <span class="token number">9</span> <span class="token number">5</span> <span class="token number">4</span> <span class="token number">2</span> <span class="token number">2</span> <span class="token number">4</span> <span class="token number">8</span> <span class="token number">7</span> <span class="token number">1</span> <span class="token number">4</span> <span class="token number">7</span> <span class="token number">6</span> <span class="token number">1</span> <span class="token number">7</span> <span class="token number">4</span> <span class="token number">0</span> <span class="token number">4</span>  <span class="token operator">=&gt;</span>  Weight <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token number">75</span>
After <span class="token number">4</span> <span class="token parameter">generations</span>  <span class="token operator">=&gt;</span>  <span class="token number">995647252341867112427660197849014</span>  <span class="token operator">=&gt;</span>  Weight <span class="token operator">=</span> <span class="token number">150</span></code></pre><p>The <code>914</code> colony has a weight of <code>150</code> after 4 generations. And after 10 generations, the weight will be <code>9370</code>.</p>
<h3 id="part-a---20">Part A - 20%</h3>
<p>Find the weight of the given colony after 10 generations</p>
<h3 id="part-b---80">Part B - 80%</h3>
<p>Find the weight of the given colony after 50 generations</p>
<h1 id="evaluation">Evaluation</h1>
<p>Expose a <code>POST</code> endpoint <code>/digital-colony</code> for us to call</p>
<p>MIME type of <code>application/json</code> are expected for both request and response</p>
<h3 id="request">Request</h3>
<p>You will be given a JSON array with a length of 2</p>
<p>Each item in the array has the following fields</p>
<ul>
<li><code>generations</code> - a number 10 for Part A and 50 for Part B</li>
<li><code>colony</code> - a string of a random number ranging from 1000 to 9999</li>
</ul>
<pre><code><span class="token punctuation">[</span>
    <span class="token punctuation">{</span> <span class="token literal-property property">generations</span><span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token number">10</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token literal-property property">colony</span><span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">"1000"</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
    <span class="token punctuation">{</span> <span class="token literal-property property">generations</span><span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token number">50</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span> <span class="token literal-property property">colony</span><span class="token operator">:</span> <span class="token string">"1000"</span> <span class="token punctuation">}</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">]</span></code></pre><h3 id="response">Response</h3>
<p>Your endpoint will have to respond with a JSON array of 2 strings</p>
<p>Each string represents the weight of the given colony after their respective number of generations passes</p>
<pre><code><span class="token punctuation">[</span>
    <span class="token string">"13796"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
    <span class="token string">"15199648470930596"</span><span class="token punctuation">,</span>
<span class="token punctuation">]</span></code></pre></div></template>
  

</body></html>
